questions.question: Which of the following diuretics acts by inhibiting the Na-K-2Cl symporter in the thick ascending limb of the loop of Henle?
Which diuretic class is most likely to cause hypokalemia as a side effect?
What is the primary mechanism of action of spironolactone?
options: Inhibition of aldosterone receptors in the distal tubule
Inhibition of the Na-K-2Cl symporter in the loop of Henle
Inhibition of carbonic anhydrase in the proximal tubule
Inhibition of sodium channels in the distal tubule
questions.answer: Inhibition of aldosterone receptors in the distal tubule

questions.question: Which of the following diuretics is most appropriate for managing edema in a patient with congestive heart failure and hyperkalemia?
What is the primary site of action of thiazide diuretics?
options: Thick ascending limb of the loop of Henle
